pullRequest.title: [plsql] Fix in Comment statement
pullRequest.bodyText:
Before submitting a PR, please check that:

 The PR is submitted against master. The PMD team will merge back to support branches as needed.
 ./mvnw clean verify passes. This will build and test PMD, execute PMD and checkstyle rules. Check this for more info

PR Description:
Small fix in Comment statement with test case.
Ending comment without ";", but with "/" is accepted by SQLPlus
Also removed not needed productions (CursorSpecification, ...) and reformat some code.

commit.message: small fix in Comment statement, removed not needed cursorSpecification, code formatting

nodes.bodyText: I'd rather keep these braces. What happens if someone later wants to add a second statement and forgets to put it into the braces?

Removing CursorSpecification actually breaks compatibility, because now the Cursor is parsed as CursorBody.
I'll change it so that we remove CursorBody instead and keep CursorSpecification.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -473,8 +473,6 @@ ASTDeclarativeUnit DeclarativeUnit()  :
 		ProgramUnit()  |
 		LOOKAHEAD(4)
 		VariableOrConstantDeclaration() |
-		LOOKAHEAD(2)
-		CursorSpecification() |
